BTN Digugat SAN Finance, Erick Thohir: Tunggu Direksi Baru
05 Nov 2019, 08:15 by Dias Prasongko, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Menteri Badan Usaha Milik Negara atau BUMN Erick Thohir mengatakan belum mendapat laporan terkait gugatan PT Surya Artha Nusantara Finance (SAN Finance) terhadap PT Bank Tabungan Negara (Persero) Tbk. atau BTN. BTN digugat karena dana SAN Finance yang disimpan menghilang.
"Belum terima laporan, kami tunggu direktur utama yang baru," kata Erick saat ditemui di kantor Kementerian Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian, Jakarta Pusat, Selasa 5 November 2019. Terkait direktur utama yang baru, Erick meminta untuk menunggu RUPSLB BTN pada akhir bulan November.
Adapun saat ini posisi Direktur Utama Bank Tabungan Negara mengalami kekosongan. Kursi direktur utama kini diisi oleh pelaksana tugas harian (Plh) Oni Febrianto, yang sebelumnya menjabat sebagai Direktur Commercial and Banking Bank Tabungan Negara.
Kekosongan posisi Direktur Utama BTN terjadi usai mantan Direktur Utama PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia (Persero) Tbk. Suprajarto menolak keputusan RUPSLB BTN. Suprajarto seharusnya mengisi posisi tersebut menggantikan Maryono sebagai direktur utama sebelumnya.
Sementara itu, kasus gugatan keduanya bermula saat SAN Finance menaruh dananya dalam bentuk tabungan giro ke BTN pada 2016. Saat itu, SAN Finance menaruh dana sebesar Rp 250 miliar sejak 2016 dalam 3 tahap.
Namun, belakangan SAN Finance menerima kabar bahwa dana mereka yang disimpan tersebut ternyata hilang sebesar Rp 110 miliar. Informasi tersebut diperoleh SAN Finace langsung dari BTN pada tanggal 20 Desember 2016.
Menurut keterangan SAN Finance, perusahaan pernah melakukan konfirmasi mengenai dana yang hilang tersebut pada 2016. Perusahaan bahkan telah menggunakan jalur hukum supaya dana tersebut bisa kembali.
Paling anyar, kasus gugatan SAN Finance terhadap BTN telah memasuki tahap pengajuan peninjauan kembali (PK) atas putusan kasasi Mahkamah Agung (MAk ke Pengadilan Negeri Jakarta Pusat pada 3 Oktober 2019. Saat ini, SAN Finance dikabarkan masih menunggu pengajuan PK tersebut.

BTN Sued SAN Finance, Erick Thohir: Wait for the New Directors
05 Nov 2019, 08:15 by Dias Prasongko, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Minister of State-Owned Enterprises or BUMN Erick Thohir said that he had not received a report related to the lawsuit of PT Surya Artha Nusantara Finance (SAN Finance) against PT Bank Tabungan Negara (Persero) Tbk. or BTN. BTN was sued because SAN Finance funds deposited disappeared.
"We have not received the report, we are waiting for the new president director," Erick said when met at the office of the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Central Jakarta, Tuesday, November 5, 2019. Regarding the new president director, Erick asked to wait for the BTN EGM at the end of November.
Now the position of President Director of the National Savings Bank is experiencing a vacancy. The chair of the president director is now filled by the executor of daily duties (Plh) Oni Febrianto, who previously served as Director of Commercial and Banking of the State Savings Bank.
The vacancy of the position of President Director of BTN occurred after the former President Director of PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia (Persero) Tbk. Suprajarto rejected the BTN RUPSLB decision. Suprajarto should fill this position replacing Maryono as the previous president director.
Meanwhile, the second lawsuit case began when SAN Finance put its funds in the form of demand deposits to BTN in 2016. At that time, SAN Finance put funds of Rp 250 billion since 2016 in 3 stages.
However, SAN Finance recently received news that their deposited funds were apparently lost at Rp 110 billion. The information was obtained by SAN Finace directly from BTN on December 20, 2016.
According to SAN Finance, the company has confirmed the lost funds in 2016. The company has even used legal channels so that the funds can be returned.
Most recently, the SAN Finance lawsuit case against BTN has entered the stage of filing a review (PK) of the Supreme Court's appeal decision (MAk to the Central Jakarta District Court on October 3, 2019. Currently, SAN Finance is reportedly still awaiting the submission of the PK.
